admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
trustfund:
TF024890-INDSTL TRADE POLICY
            ADJ.-TRANCHE 1,2,3,4,TF027690-PHRD-INDUSTRIAL TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Technology
            Development Project for Turkey was satisfactory with a
            likely sustainability. Improvement occurred in three
            important areas: the creation of a research and development
            culture among Turkish industry and increased private sector
            participation in technology development; launching of a
            technology finance industry where non existed; and an
            improved capacity and access to technology infrastructure
            and services. Key lessons learned include: When launching
            new activities, emphasize private sector participation in
            decision making. Specific market deficiencies in
            technological development must be identified and addressed.
            The design of technology development projects needs to be
            kept as simple and as flexible as possible. Priorities and
            strategies for investment should be clarified for each
            component as early as possible, the methodologies for each
            country can be subject to experimentation and may be
            approached on a pilot basis. Public support is critical in
            launching proactive measures to inform industry of benefits.
            Measures to stimulate firm-level technology upgrading
            require the development of specialized skills to evaluate
            and monitor technology projects on the part of the provider
            institution. Supervision should be maintained at a fairly
            intensive level throughout implementation, and can be
            enhanced by the use of external experts.
